instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
I am very happy because LOUIS got the Forums working !!!
Had liquid damage , after cleaning the board there was no 
backlight , I did reflow the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> then worked for 2 days 
then again no backlight , I replaced for new <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> but still no backlight , thought I might did  bad soldering joint !!! take it off cleaned bad very well , soldered another <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> but still nothing no backlight .

threads.title: board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Check traces between <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and L/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
Pay atention to XW7720.
Post voltages on both pins od <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
